item.title: Australia rejects French accusations of lying over subs deal
item.description: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison on Sunday rejected France's accusations Canberra lied about plans to cancel a contract to buy French submarines, saying he had raised concerns over the deal "some months ago."

item.title: Pacquiao chosen as PDP-Laban faction standard bearer for Eleksyon 2022
item.description: Senator Emmanuel “Manny” Pacquiao on Sunday accepted the Partido Demokratiko Pilipino - Lakas ng Bayan (PDP-Laban) nomination to be the party s presidential candidate in the upcoming 2022 national elections.

item.title: PNP: Cops with COVID-19 now at 38,219
item.description: The Philippine National Police on Sunday reported 162 new cases of the novelcoronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) among its personnel, bringing the total tally to 38,219.

item.title: New Philippine COVID-19 infections hit 19,271; active cases at 178,196
item.description: The Philippines reported 19,271 new COVID-19 infections on Sunday, raising the number of active cases in the country to 178,196.

item.title: Eleazar orders probe into death of delivery rider in Tondo
item.description: Philippine National Police chief Police General Guillermo Eleazar ordered an investigation into the death of a delivery rider in Tondo, Manila involving a police officer.

item.title: Pimentel insists on faction's legitimacy; vows to fight hijackers of PDP-Laban
item.description: Senator Aquilino "Koko" Pimentel III on Sunday insisted that they were the legitimate representatives of PDP-Laban and that they would fight hijackers of their party.

item.title: Gov't should be cooperative in ICC drug war probe --Pimentel
item.description: Senator Aquilino "Koko" Pimentel III on Sunday said the national government needs to be cooperative in the International Criminal Court's (ICC) investigation of drug war killings as well as deaths in Davao City under President Rodrigo Duterte's leadership.

item.title: No moves to expel Duterte from PDP-Laban -Pimentel
item.description: Despite President Rodrigo Duterte's ongoing rift with Senator Manny Pacquiao, Senator Aquilino "Koko" Pimentel III said on Sunday that there were no plans to expel the President from the PDP-Laban during the party's national assembly.

item.title: Relatives of Afghan family killed in US strike want face-to-face apology
item.description: Relatives of the victims of a US drone strike that wiped out 10 members of an Afghan family in a "tragic mistake" demanded a face-to-face apology and compensation on Saturday.

item.title: Cops exercised tolerance at Manila anti-vax rally --MPD5 OIC
item.description: Police personnel acted with maximum tolerance on protesters at the anti-COVID vaccine rally held at the Liwasang Bonifacio in Manila on Saturday.

item.title: Panel approves COVID-19 jabs for kids; but still working on when vaccinations start -DOH
item.description: While the national government's panel of experts approved COVID-19 vaccinations for children, they were still determining the optimum moment to start inoculations, the Department of Health (DOH) said Sunday.

item.title: Eleazar orders manhunt vs. Datu Piang, Maguindanao blast suspects
item.description: Philippine National Police chief Police General Guillermo Eleazar on Sunday ordered a manhunt for the suspects behind the blast from an improvised explosive device in Datu Piang, Maguindanao on Saturday.

item.title: Robredo to DILG: Empathize, don't punish those refusing swab test
item.description: Vice President Leni Robredo on Sunday hit the Department of the Interior and Local Government over its sanctions on those refusing the RT-PCR test as Filipinos continue to grapple with the pandemic.

item.title: Robredo backs calls to extend voter registration by one month
item.description: Vice President Leni Robredo said on Sunday that she supported calls to extend the voter registration period by one more month, reasoning that it was necessary due to the "extraordinary circumstances" of the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Robredo questions effectiveness of face shield against COVID-19
item.description: Amid the controversies hounding the government's procurement of COVID-19 supplies in 2020, Vice President Leni Robredo on Sunday questioned if face shields are effective in preventing COVID-19 transmission.
